maze.logic

Class Maze

  • java.lang.Object
    • maze.logic.Maze
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class responsible for the creation and manipulation of the maze used in the game. It contains all the functions responsible for the movement of the maze elements in the maze and the constructor and initializers of that structure.
    Author:
    Rui Figueira - ei11021, Pedro Faria - ei11167
    See Also:
    Serializable, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Maze()
      Constructor of the standard maze
      Maze(int n)
      Constructor of the random maze which size is specified by the user
      Maze(int n, char c)
      Constructor of a maze with or without walls inside

      • initializeMaze

        public void initializeMaze()
        Function responsible for initializing the standard maze. It initializes all the chars on pre-calculated coordinates of the maze.

      • initializeMaze

        public void initializeMaze(int m)
        Function responsible for initializing the random maze with the size m x m. It initializes all the chars randomly on the maze.
        Parameters:
        m - Size of the random maze

      • heroTurn

        public void heroTurn(char direction)
        Function responsible for the hero movements on the maze
        Parameters:

      • checkIfDragonsAreDead

        public boolean checkIfDragonsAreDead(int i)
        Function responsible for checking if all the dragons in the maze are dead
        Parameters:
        i - position to check in the dragons array
        Returns:
        false if some dragon is alive or true if all dragons are dead.

      • dragonTurn

        public void dragonTurn()
        Function responsible for the dragon(s) movement(s)

      • dragonTurn

        public void dragonTurn(int dragonDirection,
              boolean isAsleep)
        Same function as dragonTurn() but made to test the dragon conditions in Junit
        Parameters:
        dragonDirection - Direction of the movement of the dragon
        isAsleep - false if the dragon is to be sleeping or true if the dragon is to be awake
